abstract: Amherst College in Massachusetts joins ranks of schools across nation addressing issue of mascots and logos seen as celebrating historical figures now equated with racial injustice; college's longtime unofficial mascot, Lord Jeffery Amherst, was 18th-century military commander believed by many to have ordered mass killing of Native Americans through distribution of blankets infected with smallpox virus.
lead_paragraph: The colonial legacy of Lord Jeffery Amherst, the unofficial face of the college, has generated increasing opposition, but traditionalists are resisting calls for a change.

headline.main: At Amherst College, Some Say It’s the Mascot’s Turn to Embrace Diversity
headline.print_headline: At College That Changed for Diversity, Some Say It’s the Mascot’s Turn
